chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Zachary P MacFarlan was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

/for Placement, signed and filed.

Defendant Zachary P MacFarlan in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Also present in court:  Mr. John Cook, WCS.  Hearing on conditional release proceeds.  Parties stipulate to the Conditional Release Plan.  Court approves same and defendant will be under the supervision of WCS and the Department of Corrections in a community setting as outlined in the plan.  Mr. Cook indicated that 5/22/16 would be defendant's release date.  Court ordered defendant to remain compliant with all conditions set forth in the Conditional Release Plan, to include no possession of illegal drugs or alcohol; defendant may also not travel out of the state of Wisconsin.  Order signed and filed.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
Proposed Conditional Release Plan dated 4/17/15, received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of COURT PROCEEDINGS commencing 12/02/2014 received and filed. (20 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Melissa Fitzsimmons, 819 North 6th Street, Room 908, Milwaukee, 53203-1606.

Defendant Zachary P MacFarlan in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. John Cook, WCS, also appeared in person.  Parties are in receipt of the report from WCS and from Attorney Fitzsimmons.  Dr. Pankiewicz's testimony not needed; Forensic Unit notified of same.  State agrees to release to the community.  Court concurs, approved same and ordered a conditional release plan to include anger management counseling, defendant to make no threats, and that defendant cannot use or possess firearms or weapons.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered matter set for hearing before Branch 20, with the report due one week prior so all parties can review same.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary P MacFarlan not in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court to receive new court date, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date of 2/06/15 at 8:30 a.m.

/from Ms. Brooks of WCS dated 1/09/15, received and filed.

/of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect), signed nunc pro tunc to 12/02/14 and filed.  Copy e-mailed to ADA Kronforst, Attorney Fitzsimmons and WCS to Ms. Brown, Ms. Shequen and Mr. Oldenburg.

Court granted defense request for modification of No Contact Order as State had no objection.  Court modified the No Contact Order to a NO VIOLENT Contact Order with Jacqueline R. or Bradley R.  and eliminated issue of residence on the No Contact Order. Court warned defendant that he must remain compliant with conditions of bail to include anger management and impulsivity control, and remain in compliance with rules and regulations of current housing group home.
In light of State, defense counsel's availability, as well as the upcoming holidays and the Court's schedule, defense counsel waived time limits.  Court approved same.

Defendant Zachary P MacFarlan in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. John Pankiewicz appeared in court, however, after a short meeting with ADA Kronfost, State advised the Court that his testimony would not be needed at this time and that she and defense counsel stipulate to findings of his report.   Court approves same.  Dr. Pankiewicz released from further testimony on this case.   Parties also stipulate to maximum term of commitment would be 18 months.  Court lifts stay on judgment of conviction and found defendant not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Parties request a hearing date to determine if defendant should be committed to a facility for treatment or remain in the community.  Case is adjourned for return on report before Branch 20.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/from Dr. John Pankiewicz dated 11/19/14, received and filed.
/for Examination Under 971.16, signed nunc pro tunc to 10/08/14, and filed.

Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information, but withheld entry of the Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may not longer use or possess firearms and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

 Doctor appointment set with Forensic Unit to 10/22/14 at 11:00 a.m.  Court set return of report date to the week of 11/10/14 to allow parties to go over same.

Court ordered case adjourned for hearing/return on doctor's report before Branch 20 on 12/02/14 at 8:30 a.m.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.

Defendant Zachary P MacFarlan in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant is now charged as follows:
COUNT 01: 
Misdemeanor Battery, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 940.19(1).

COUNT 02:
Obstructing an Officer, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 946.41(1).

COUNT 03:
Resisting an Officer, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 946.41(1).

Defendant Zachary P MacFarlan in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held.  Defense counsel filed waiver of trial by jury.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding same and finds that defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived his right to trial by jury.  Case to proceed with a court trial.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered matter converted to Court Trial before Branch 20.  Court trial scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Court retained file.
